result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamie A. VerHagen

Case Called: 9:38 am
INCLUDES 21CF1047, 22CF250, 21CT263.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Dan Cveykus;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
21CF1047:
Ct. 1>> Delete 'Repeater' Enhancer.
Ct. 2 (Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)-Repeater)>>DRI.

22CF250:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.

21CT263:
Ct. 1 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)-Repeater)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
21CF1047:
Ct. 1 (Operate with Restricted Controlled Substances (4th))>> NO CONTEST. 

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
21CF1047:
Ct. 1 (Operate with Restricted Controlled Substances (4th))>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation. CONDITIONS: $600 Fine plus Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. 3 Months MCJ with Huber privileges, Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 3 Years, as is the defendant herself, and device to be installed immediately; IID installation fee to be paid; 3 Year dl revocation with any administrative credit; AODA, Absolute Sobriety. Court finds 0 Days credit. 

Adjourned: 9:49 am
